item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: Callouts
item.description: A callout is an attention-grabbing block. Attention-grabbing blocks help enhance the skimmability of a document. [!info] Callout Example This is an example of a callout

item.title: Cloud Security Scanners
item.description: To understand Cloud Security Scanners, there are some important pieces of prerequisite knowledge you must have [[cloud architecture]] [[design patterns]] [[anti-patterns]] Please review those and come back when you are ready.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Container
item.description: A container is a cordoned off computational construct. When a program runs within a container, all [[notes/operating-system]] [[API]] calls are handled by the container’s virtualization tools rather than the actual [[notes/operating-system]].

item.title: Docker
item.description: Docker is a [[container]] virtualization program. It can be thought of as a front end for various virtualization tools such as the [[Linux]] kernel’s [[KVM]].

item.title: GOATed v. YOTED
item.description: A GOATed tool is a tool that is the Greatest of All Time. GOATed tools do the thing that they are supposed to do without issue.

item.title: Infrastructure as Code
item.description: When working with the cloud, you will have many different pieces of disposable infrastructure as part of your tech stack and platform solution.

item.title: Operating System
item.description: An Operating System is responsible for managing resources. A computer without an operating system can only run one program from boot-up to shut down.

item.title: Terraform
item.description: Terraform is an [[notes/infrastructure-as-code]] tool created by HashiCorp.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)
